item.title: Arduino Watering System
item.description: It’s not often that one gets to program with the physical world, but I must say, this project sparked a newfound appreciation for programming.

item.title: Stock Price Scraper
item.description: Understanding Pandas in Python: This was one of my first projects in python to understand data frames.

item.title: Housing Price Analysis
item.description: This was one of my initial projects in python to attempt to understand the language’s capabilites for data analysis.

item.title: The United States is Risking Their Position in the Global Financial System
item.description: It would be very tough to argue against the fact that we’re living in changing times.

item.title: Visa's acquisition of Plaid
item.description: On January 13th, 2020, Visa came out publicly announcing the purchase of the banking startup called Plaid, which provided a service that actually connected fintech startups with the ability to connect to the modern banking payment rails.

item.title: Thoughts On Modern Monetary Theory
item.description: Gregory Mankiw recently provided his take on MMT in A Skepticâ€™s Guide to Modern Monetary Theory.

item.title: Student Debt Increasing
item.description: Student Loans A Lot Like The Subprime Mortgage Debacle, Watchdog Says - From NPR

item.title: College debt is making it harder for people to get married
item.description: It is pretty well known that the outstanding college debt burden is surging and having spill over effects on individual’s choices.

item.title: Reed students validate college ranking
item.description: I came across this great article about a group of Reed students in a statistics course that reverse engineered the US News College Ranking System in oder to determine if Reed was being penalized by not filling out info for the the proprietary ranking system.

item.title: Questions about economics
item.description: Questions About Economics I was lucky enough to be asked by one of my favorite undergrad professors, Ed Whitelaw, to come back down to Eugene to speak on a panel of his past students to speak.

item.title: The Marvel of the Human Dad
item.description: The marvel of the Human Dad is a great article I stumbled upon the other day.

item.title: Understanding Object Oriented Programming
item.description: Classes and Programming Paradigms for Python Programming paradigms, at least in my case of teaching myself programming, was something that I didn’t stress but should have.

item.title: Conversations with Tyler: Robin Wiblin from 80000 Hours
item.description: I feel fairly comfortable stating that this is my favorite podcast of the year.

item.title: Kierkegaard on boredom
item.description: Kierkegaard on Boredom and Busyness: This was a great article about Soren Kierkegaard’s discourse on being busy.

item.title: Heads or Tails - Paper on big life choices
item.description: Interesting paper by the ever excellent Steven Levitt, HEADS OR TAILS: THE IMPACT OF A COIN TOSS ON MAJOR LIFE DECISIONS AND SUBSEQUENT HAPPINESS

item.title: Interactive Exploration of Dead End Careers
item.description: I read this wonderful analysis, originally posted by Zippia on the dynamics of salaries across age and labor demographics, via the PUMS (Public Use Microdata Sample) for you acronym junkies out there.

item.title: Predict Economics Indicators with OpenStreetMap
item.description: This was a really cool article regarding the use of OpenStreeMap to predict the economic potential and output of a country.

item.title: First of Many!
item.description: Welcome! Well it’s awesome to see that you’ve found it here.
This is my blog Hey there nice to meet you, for a background we’ll cover that in a bit.
